CTRE 0.1.0
  • Reference

Continuous Time Random Exceedances

CTRE-package.Rd

Fits a Continuous Time Random Exceedance model to bursty time series. CTREs model the distribution of threshold crossing times of extreme events. Fits are made by interactive visual assessment of "stability plots" using a shiny app.

References

"Peaks Over Threshold for Bursty Time Series", Katharina Hees, Smarak Nayak, Peter Straka. https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.05218

See also

Useful links:

  • https://unsw-math.github.io/CTRE/

  • Report bugs at https://github.com/strakaps/CTRE/issues

Examples

library(CTRE)
# NOT RUN {
runCTREshiny()
# }

ctre_mod <- ctre(flares)
ctre_mod
#> 'ctre' object with 2488 timestamps and magnitudes.
#> Timestamps:
#>  POSIXct[1:2488], format: "1982-01-01 00:55:00" "1982-01-01 16:43:15" "1982-01-01 22:13:16" ...
#> Magnitudes:
#>  int [1:2488] 2404 94 60 53 107 5363 61 262 85 83 ...
length(ctre_mod)
#> [1] 2488
ctre_mod <- thin(ctre_mod, k = 500)
ctre_mod
#> 'ctre' object with 500 timestamps and magnitudes.
#> Timestamps:
#>  POSIXct[1:500], format: "1982-01-01 00:55:00" "1982-01-02 06:09:42" "1982-01-03 00:11:51" ...
#> Magnitudes:
#>  int [1:500] 2404 5363 262 421 2309 655 685 935 984 9763 ...
magnitudes(ctre_mod)

MLestimates(ctre_mod, tail = 0.8, scale = 3E7)
#> Computing Mittag-Leffler estimates for all thresholds.
library(magrittr)
ctre_mod %>% interarrival() %>% mlqqplot(tail = 0.8, log = 'xy')
acf(ctre_mod)
empcopula(ctre_mod)
